chapter.title: Blow-the-ships
chapter.subtitle: A simple version of the famous game of batteships...

sect1.title: The Game Plan
sect1.para: The simple game of destroying ships on an imaginary grid. The computer puts 5 ships in a grid of 8x8 squares. The challenge for the player is to guess the correct cell which blows up the ship. A handy timer keeps track of the time and calculates the player's rank.

sect2.title: Game Rules
sect2.para: 1. The game consists of an imaginary 8x8 grid which signifies an enemy's naval base in the sea. 2. The grid's columns are named A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. 3. The grid's rows are named 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8. 4. Soon after the game starts, the computer places 5 ships (1x1 each) randomly across the imaginary grid. 5. A timer is started to kick off the game. 6. The user has to guess the location of the ships by calling out an address i.e. A7 or F5 etc. 7. The computer responds with the following: a. Hit: you have guessed the correct location, and drowned the ship. b. Miss: you have incorrectly guessed a location, and hence missed the ship. 8. When all the 5 ships are hit, the game ends. 9. The game timer is stopped, and the player's rank is displayed.

sect5.title: Next Version - Enhancements
sect5.para: 1. Flexible grid choices - 16x16 etc. 2. Flexible ship sizes - 3 small-x ships of 1x1, 3 small ships of 2x1, 3 medium ships of 3x1, 1 large ships of 5x1. 3. Score or points system. 4. Different difficulty levels. 5. Computer also specifies "warm" or "cold" hints for easy levels.
